Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Selective passage and efficient enrichment due to synergistic affinity interactions (boronic acid affinity chromatography and hydrophilic interaction chromatography) and appropriate molecular size for mesopore entry.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Loading buffer (85% ACN/50 mM NH4HCO3, v/v) at pH 8.5; ambient temperature
Other Information.Additional Info: Successfully enriched, showing high selectivity and anti-interference in mixtures with non-glycopeptides and proteins. Confirmed N-linked glycopeptides were detected, including m/z = 1158.56 and 1190.60.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Rejection due to absence of specific affinity interactions with the material and efficient elimination of non-specific binding (via BAAC and HILIC principles).

Other Information.Test Conditions: Loading buffer (85% ACN/50 mM NH4HCO3, v/v) at pH 8.5; ambient temperature; various IgG/BSA molar ratios (e.g., 1:500, 1:1000, 1:2000)
Other Information.Additional Info: High-abundance non-glycopeptides were efficiently eliminated, confirming selectivity.

Guest Molecules.Molecular Size: 5 nm x 7 nm x 7 nm (66 kDa)
Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to large molecular dimensions exceeding mesoporous channel size.

Other Information.Test Conditions: Mixed with IgG digests (500 molar equivalents BSA protein)
Other Information.Additional Info: High-molecular-weight protein was screened out, demonstrating the size-exclusion effect.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion through matched mesoporous channels, complemented by synergistic affinity interactions for selective enrichment of glycopeptides.

Experimental Validation.Method: Glycopeptide enrichment experiments followed by MALDI-TOF MS and LC-MS/MS analysis, with deglycosylation by PNGase F for confirmation.
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Excellent selectivity (1:2000, IgG/BSA, m/m); Ultralow detection limit (0.05 fmol mL-1); Good size-exclusion effect (1:500, IgG digests/BSA, m/m); Identified 1921 unique glycopeptides assigned to 1154 glycoproteins from rat liver tissue (superior to commercial products).

Other Information.Additional Info: A novel magnetic covalent organic framework (COF) nanocomposite with a core-shell structure. Endowed with phenylboronic acid functional molecules and strong hydrophilic features. Exhibits fast magnetic responsiveness and high structural stability.
